files.README.md:
# Claude Code Browser Skill

[![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT)
[![Node.js Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/node-%3E%3D18.0.0-brightgreen)](https://nodejs.org)

A browser automation skill for [Claude Code](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code) that enables natural language control of Chrome using [Stagehand](https://github.com/browserbase/stagehand). Just ask Claude to browse the web, and it handles the rest.

## Features

- **Natural Language Control** - Describe actions in plain English: "click the login button", "fill in the email field"
- **Web Scraping** - Extract structured data from any webpage with schema validation
- **Screenshots** - Automatic screenshot capture after every action for visual verification
- **Form Filling** - Fill out forms, click buttons, and interact with any web element
- **DevTools Integration** - Monitor network requests, console logs, and execute JavaScript
- **Design Token Extraction** - Extract colors, typography, spacing, and component styles from any site
- **Session Persistence** - Browser stays open between commands, preserving cookies and login state
- **Stealth Mode** - Anti-bot detection features to avoid being blocked

## Installation

### Claude Code Plugin (Recommended)

Add the marketplace and install the plugin:

```bash
# In Claude Code, run:
/plugin marketplace add Shahfarzane/claude-code-browser-skill
/plugin install browser-automation@browser-skill-marketplace
```

Then restart Claude Code for changes to take effect.

### Manual Installation

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/Shahfarzane/claude-code-browser-skill.git
cd claude-code-browser-skill

# Install dependencies (automatically builds TypeScript)
pnpm install
# or: npm install

# Link the CLI globally
npm link

# Set your API key
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY="your-api-key"
```

## Quick Start

Once installed, just ask Claude to browse:

```
"Go to Hacker News and get the top 5 stories"
"Navigate to github.com and take a screenshot"
"Fill out the contact form on example.com with test data"
```

Claude will automatically use the browser skill when appropriate.

### Direct CLI Usage

You can also use the CLI directly:

```bash
# Navigate to a URL
browser navigate https://example.com

# Perform an action
browser act "click the Sign In button"

# Extract data
browser extract "get all product names and prices" '{"name": "string", "price": "number"}'

# Take a screenshot
browser screenshot

# Close the browser
browser close
```

## Available Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `browser navigate <url>` | Navigate to a URL |
| `browser act "<action>"` | Perform a natural language action |
| `browser extract "<instruction>" [schema]` | Extract structured data |
| `browser observe "<query>"` | Discover elements on the page |
| `browser screenshot` | Take a screenshot |
| `browser design [url]` | Extract design tokens from a page |
| `browser close` | Close the browser |

### DevTools Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `browser network [filter]` | List captured network requests |
| `browser network-get <id>` | Get full request details including body |
| `browser console [filter]` | List console messages |
| `browser eval "<javascript>"` | Execute JavaScript in page context |
| `browser clear` | Clear captured DevTools data |

## Requirements

- **Node.js** >= 18.0.0
- **Google Chrome** installed locally
- **Anthropic API Key** - Set as `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` environment variable

### Chrome Installation

- **macOS/Windows**: [Download Chrome](https://www.google.com/chrome/)
- **Linux**: `sudo apt install google-chrome-stable`

## How It Works

This skill uses [Stagehand](https://github.com/browserbase/stagehand) by Browserbase, an AI-powered browser automation framework that wraps Playwright. Stagehand uses Claude to:

1. **Understand** your natural language instructions
2. **Locate** the right elements on the page
3. **Execute** the appropriate browser actions
4. **Extract** structured data with schema validation

The browser persists between commands, so you can chain multiple actions without reopening Chrome.

## Advanced Usage

### Interactive Agent Mode

For a conversational interface with multi-turn support:

```bash
pnpm run claude
# or: npm run claude
```

This starts an interactive session where you can have ongoing conversations about browser tasks.

### Design Token Extraction

Extract a complete design system from any website:

```bash
browser design https://example.com
```

Returns colors, typography, spacing, borders, button styles, and detected CSS frameworks.

### Network Monitoring

Debug API calls and monitor requests:

```bash
browser navigate https://api-heavy-site.com
browser network api          # Filter requests containing "api"
browser network-get <id>     # Get full request/response details
```

## Troubleshooting

### Chrome not found

Ensure Chrome is installed at a standard location, or the CLI will show installation instructions.

### Browser won't start

Check if port 9222 is in use by another Chrome debugging session:
```bash
lsof -i :9222
```

### API key not found

Set your Anthropic API key:
```bash
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY="your-key"
# Or create a .env file (see .env.example)
```

### Profile refresh

To clear cookies and start fresh:
```bash
rm -rf .chrome-profile
```

## Architecture

```
claude-code-browser-skill/
├── .claude/skills/browser-automation/   # Claude Code skill definition
│   ├── SKILL.md                         # Main skill instructions
│   ├── EXAMPLES.md                      # Usage examples
│   └── REFERENCE.md                     # Technical reference
├── src/
│   ├── cli.ts                           # Main CLI entry point
│   ├── browser-utils.ts                 # Chrome discovery & profiles
│   ├── stealth.ts                       # Anti-bot detection
│   └── design-extractor.ts              # Design token extraction
└── agent-browse.ts                      # Interactive agent mode
```

For detailed architecture documentation, see [docs/ARCHITECTURE.md](docs/ARCHITECTURE.md).
